title: Rajyoga Education and Research Foundation
detailsOfAchievement: Prajapita Brahma Kumaris Ishwariya Vishwa Vidyalaya and the sister organisations RajYoga Education and Research Foundation and Brahma Kumaris Academy for the Better World have set up various Wings and Departments or Faculties that conduct courses for various sections of society. Seminars, workshops and conferences are held in order share with them the applications of spirituality, the art and experience of Meditation for achieving excellence in their fields, overcome work related stresses and inspire them to have for themselves, a code of conduct to follow. It brings various important personalities in respective fields on a common platform for broad exchange of ideas and infuse fresh thinking towards solving various problems plaguing different sections of the society. Each Wing or Department does various kinds of services with a spirit of dedication. The services and facilities of the institution are free and no fee is charged. Various Wings of the institution are mentioned below- Art and Culture Wing Education Wing Media Wing Medical Wing Rural Development Wing Scientists and Engineers wing Social Service Wing Sports Wing Women Wing Youth Wing These wings organise conferences, seminars, symposiums exhibitions of national and international level, arrange lectures, creative workshops and creative study groups in schools, colleges and universities. These wings also conduct cultural programmes, empowerment camps, campaigns on environmental and health awareness etc.

detailsOfAchievement: REAP Foundation, initiated a project named â€˜ Naya Kadamâ€™, with the vision to eradicate illiteracy amongst this group of children. Naya Kadam, (meaning-a new step) symbolises an awakening , where we support these children and help them to take their new steps towards their empowerment. The project aims to educate these underprivileged children to encourage children to join schools. Volunteers from REAP, visit the slum themselves and provide all the children with quality education. All the children we have at present are between the age group of 4-12 years. We enrol these students into schools and provide them with basic necessities such as bags, notebooks, stationary etc. Naya Kadam also ensures that children are exposed to various activities such as painting, dancing and singing develop their personal skills. We also organize donation events in these slum areas and make difference to our society in any way possible.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The organization was registered in November 2014, and Rs. 200 was received as a donation.

Central Square foundation is a Delhi based private funding agency. It had approved a grant of 30 lacs for interventions in 30 schools under South Delhi Municipal Corporation to facilitate parental and community participation in schools. In addition, Saajha received support from individual donors, and was able to receive about 35 lacs for the financial year. It also received support from Deshpande Foundation and Tata Trusts.
Saajha received a total funds of about 28 lacs during the financial year 2016-17. This included a grant support from Deshpande Foundation, Tata Trusts and Central Square Foundation.

A grant support of ~15 lacs from Deshpande foundation, ~24 lacs from Axis bank foundation for supporting municipal schools in Delhi, ~10 lacs from NASSCOM for rollout of SMC app, ~5 lacs from Affle and ~24 lacs from ATE Chandra foundation for supporting our project in Delhi and Jharkhand

Other grant support from Info Edge ~68 lacs for supporting interventions in Delhi, ~10 lacs from Infosys Foundation for supporting municipal schools, ATE Chandra foundation for org capacity building and other donors

title: SAATHI
detailsOfAchievement: We SAATHI is a charitable society registered under Societies Registration Act, 1860 with registration no. S-34847/1999 and having registered office at 421 & 423, 4th floor, Devika Tower-6, Nehru Place, New Delhi-110019. We have established an old age home at Khasra Nos. 328/4, 505, 1093, 1094, 1095, situated in Village Malikpur Kohi alias Rangpuri, Tehsil Mehrauli, New Delhi. The objective of our old age home is to take care of insecure, ignored and uncared old peoples, providing free boarding/lodging at our Old Age Home, providing free of cost food and Medical care, providing Counselling, Recreational facilities and organizing other Rehabilitation programs. The Admission in the old age home is open to destitute, insecure, ignored, uncared and infirm old Persons, who are in the age group of 60 years and above, who have none to support or maintain them and who are not suffering from any infectious/communicable disease. Following are the details of infrastructure available at our old age home: a) No. of Halls - 4 b) No. of Beds - 40 c) No. of Toilets - 4 d) Kitchen - 1 e) Lawn - 1 f) Other necessary facilities

Moreover, the NGO is imparting skill training for several talented and needy students in the diversified disciplines in the media world by running Sadhna Academy of Media Studies at Noida. Sadhna Foundation holds Socio-cultural events in different parts of our nation by way of spreading Indian culture, history, music and art and spirituality.
